message.content:
I'll solve this step by step using the financial statements provided.

## Current Ratio
Current Ratio = Total Current Assets / Total Current Liabilities
Current Ratio = 8,538,597.02 / 3,428,090.41 = 2.49

## Gross Profit Margin
Gross Profit Margin = (Gross Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%
Gross Profit Margin = (1,641,807.77 / 8,361,807.77) × 100% = 19.63%

## Debt to Asset Ratio
Debt to Asset Ratio = Total Liabilities / Total Assets
Debt to Asset Ratio = 3,428,090.41 / 15,086,049.65 = 0.23

## Net Profit Margin
Net Profit Margin = (Net Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%
Net Profit Margin = (-1,342,040.76 / 8,361,807.77) × 100% = -16.05%

## Cash to Current Debt Ratio
Cash to Current Debt Ratio = (Cash on Hand + Bank Deposits) / Total Current Liabilities
Cash to Current Debt Ratio = (1,379,124.39 + 126,796.33) / 3,428,090.41 = 0.44

## Free Cash Flow (FCF)
FCF = Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities - Capital Expenditures
FCF = -4,900,875.61 - 1,593,203.67 = -6,494,079.28

## Return on Assets (ROA)
ROA = (Net Profit / Total Assets) × 100%
ROA = (-1,342,040.76 / 15,086,049.65) × 100% = -8.90%

